topic.title: Introduction to Oracle Real Application Clusters
Connecting to Oracle Database and Exploring It

tab.title: Installing and Upgrading
tab.description: Installation guides for Oracle Database 12c and accompanying products on various platforms are collected here.Full Installation Guides describe a wider variety of scenarios with more detail.Client Installation Guides describe installing Oracle database client software on hosts where the database server is not installed.Supplementary Installation Guides describe installing products that are included with the database but installed separately.

document.title: Readme
document.summary: Describes last-minute features and changes not included in the Oracle Database Documentation Library for Oracle Database 12c Release 1 (12.1)

document.title: Upgrade Guide
document.summary: Guides you through the process of planning and performing upgrades for Oracle Database. This book also provides information about compatibility, upgrading applications, and changes in the new release that affect upgrading Oracle Database.

document.title: Migration Guide
document.summary: Describes the installation, configuration, and administration tasks for all activities related to migrating applications to Oracle Database from other databases, including DB2, MySQL, and Sybase.

document.title: Migration Assistant for Unicode Guide
document.summary: Introduces you to the Oracle Database Migration Assistant for Unicode, discusses the database character set migration process, and verifies that there are no character set data problems in a current Unicode database.

document.title: Release Notes for Linux
document.summary: Contains important information not included in the Oracle Database documentation for Linux.

document.title: Database Installation Guide for Linux
document.summary: Provides configuration information for network and system administrators, and database installation information for database administrators (DBAs) who install and configure Oracle Database and Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a standalone server on Linux.

document.title: Database Client Installation Guide for Linux
document.summary: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database client on Linux.

document.title: Database Quick Installation Guide for IBM: Linux on System z
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Z/Linux systems.

document.title: Database Client Quick Installation Guide for IBM: Linux on System z
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on Z/Linux systems.

document.title: Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for Linux
document.summary: Describes how to install Grid Infrastructure for a cluster software, which includes Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM), on systems running Linux.

document.title: Real Application Clusters Installation Guide for Linux and UNIX
document.summary: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) on systems running Linux and UNIX.

document.title: Database Client Quick Installation Guide for Linux x86-64
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on Linux x86-64 systems.

document.title: Database Quick Installation Guide for Linux x86-64
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Linux x86-64 systems.

document.title: Release Notes for Microsoft Windows
document.summary: Contains important information not included in Oracle Database documentation for Windows.

document.title: Database Quick Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows x64 (64-Bit)
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Windows x64 systems.

document.title: Database Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows
document.summary: Provides configuration information for network and system administrators, and database installation information for database administrators (DBAs) who install and configure Oracle Database and Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a standalone server on Windows.

document.title: Database Client Quick Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows x64 (64-Bit)
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on Windows x64 systems.

document.title: Database Client Quick Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows (32-Bit)
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on Windows 32-bit systems.

document.title: Database Client Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows
document.summary: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database Client on Windows.

document.title: Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows x64 (64-Bit)
document.summary: Describes how to install grid infrastructure for a cluster software, which includes Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM), on systems running Microsoft Windows.

document.title: Real Application Clusters Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows x64 (64-Bit)
document.summary: Describes how to install Oracle Real Application Clusters on the Microsoft Windows platform.

document.title: Release Notes for Oracle Solaris
document.summary: Contains important information not included in Oracle Database documentation for Solaris.

document.title: Database Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris
document.summary: Provides configuration information for network and system administrators, and database installation information for database administrators (DBAs) who install and configure Oracle Database, and Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a standalone server on Oracle Solaris.

document.title: Database Client Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris
document.summary: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database Client on Oracle Solaris.

document.title: Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris
document.summary: Describes how to install Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a cluster software, which includes Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM), on systems running Oracle Solaris.

document.title: Database Quick Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris on SPARC (64-Bit)
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Oracle Solaris on SPARC (64-Bit).

document.title: Database Quick Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris on x86-64 (64-Bit)
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Oracle Solaris on x86-64 (64-Bit).

document.title: Database Client Quick Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris on SPARC (64-Bit)
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on Oracle Solaris on SPARC (64-Bit).

document.title: Database Client Quick Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris on x86-64 (64-Bit)
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Oracle Solaris on x86-64 (64-Bit).

document.title: Release Notes for HP-UX Itanium
document.summary: Contains information that was not included in the platform-specific or product-specific documentation for this release.

document.title: Database Quick Installation Guide for HP-UX Itanium
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on HP-UX Itanium systems.

document.title: Database Installation Guide for HP-UX Itanium
document.summary: Provides configuration information for network and system administrators, and database installation information for database administrators (DBAs) who install and configure Oracle Database, and Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a standalone server on HP-UX systems.

document.title: Database Client Installation Guide for HP-UX Itanium
document.summary: Provides configuration information for network and system administrators, and database installation information for database administrators (DBAs) who install and configure Oracle Database, and Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a standalone server on HP-UX systems.

document.title: Database Client Quick Installation Guide for HP-UX Itanium
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on HP-UX Itanium.

document.title: Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for HP-UX Itanium
document.summary: Describes how to install Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a Cluster software, which includes Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM), on systems running HP-UX Itanium.

document.title: Release Notes for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
document.summary: Contains important information not included in Oracle Database documentation for AIX.

document.title: Database Quick Installation Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit).

document.title: Database Installation Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
document.summary: Provides configuration information for network and system administrators, and database installation information for database administrators (DBAs) who install and configure Oracle Database, and Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a standalone server on IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit).

document.title: Database Client Quick Installation Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
document.summary: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit).

document.title: Database Client Installation Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
document.summary: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database Client on IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit).

document.title: Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
document.summary: Describes how to install Grid Infrastructure for a cluster software, which includes Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM), on systems running IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit).

document.title: Database Examples Installation Guide
document.summary: Describes how to install and configure the products available on the Oracle Database Examples installation media.

document.title: Database Gateway for APPC Installation and Configuration Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit), Linux x86-64, Oracle Solaris on SPARC (64-Bit), and HP-UX Itanium
document.summary: Provides Oracle applications with seamless access to IBM mainframe data and services through Remote Procedure Call (RPC) processing.

document.title: Database Gateway for APPC Installation and Configuration Guide for Microsoft Windows
document.summary: Provides Oracle applications with seamless access to IBM mainframe data and services through Remote Procedure Call (RPC) processing.

document.title: Database Gateway Installation and Configuration Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit), Linux x86-64, Oracle Solaris on SPARC (64-Bit), Oracle Solaris on x86-64 (64-Bit), and HP-UX Itanium
document.summary: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database Gateway for Sybase, Informix, Teradata, SQL Server, ODBC, and DRDA on UNIX-based platforms.

document.title: Database Gateway Installation and Configuration Guide for Microsoft Windows
document.summary: Describes how to install Oracle Database Gateway for Sybase, Informix, Teradata, SQL Server, ODBC, and DRDA on Microsoft Windows (32-bit) and Microsoft Windows (64-bit) platform.

portlet.title: Upgrade and Migration Scenario Virtual Books for Linux

document.title: Migrating and Upgrading an Oracle Database to Linux Using Data Pump

portlet.title: Upgrade and Migration Scenario Virtual Books for Solaris

document.title: Migrating and Upgrading an Oracle Database to Solaris Using Data Pump
Upgrade and migrate to Solaris and Oracle ASM from third-party vendor storage

tab.title: Database Administration
tab.description: "Essentials" covers everyday database administration tasks, as performed using the Enterprise Manager GUI. "Supporting Documentation" includes in-depth concept, task and reference material.

document.title: 2 Day DBA
document.summary: Provides a single source reference for administering Oracle Database in a small to midsize environment, using the graphical user interface of Oracle Enterprise Manager Database Express. If you are familiar with computers, but unfamiliar with administering Oracle Database, and your computer has four CPUs or fewer, and you do not expect to support more than 500 users, this book is appropriate for you.

document.title: 2 Day + Security Guide
document.summary: Provides an introduction to securing an Oracle database using the default security features, such as how to secure the database installation and configuration or manage encryption. It includes beginning level tutorials for creating secure application roles, Oracle Database Vault policies, Oracle Virtual Private Database policies, Oracle Data Redaction policies, Oracle Label Security policies, and unified auditing policies.

document.title: 2 Day + Performance Tuning Guide
document.summary: Explains how to perform day-to-day database performance tuning tasks using features provided by Oracle Diagnostics Pack, Oracle Tuning Pack, and Oracle Enterprise Manager Cloud Control.

document.title: Concepts
document.summary: Describes Oracle Database architecture and essential topics for database administrators and developers.

document.title: Administrator's Guide
document.summary: Describes how to create, configure, and administer an Oracle database. Includes sections on Oracle Scheduler, Oracle Database Resource Manager, Oracle Restart, Pluggable Databases, and distributed computing.

document.title: Reference
document.summary: Provides reference information about database initialization parameters, static data dictionary views, and dynamic performance views that are part of Oracle Database.

document.title: SQL Language Reference
document.summary: Contains a complete description of Oracle SQL, the language used to manage information in Oracle Database.

document.title: Performance Tuning Guide
document.summary: Provides information about how to tune the performance of Oracle Database using Oracle performance tools.

document.title: SQL Tuning Guide
document.summary: Describes how to perform SQL tuning, which is the iterative process of improving SQL statement performance to meet specific, measurable, and achievable goals.

document.title: Error Messages
document.summary: Describes error messages that may appear while using products that are part of Oracle Database.

document.title: SQL Language Reference
document.summary: Contains a complete description of Oracle SQL, the language used to manage information in Oracle Database.

document.title: SQL Language Quick Reference
document.summary: Contains a high-level text description of the SQL syntax used to manage information in Oracle Database.

document.title: PL/SQL Language Reference
document.summary: Presents PL/SQL, the Oracle procedural extension of SQL, an advanced fourth-generation programming language. Explains the concepts behind PL/SQL and illustrates every facet of the language.

document.title: PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference
document.summary: Describes the PL/SQL packages provided with the Oracle database server that extend database functionality and provide PL/SQL access to SQL features.

document.title: Development Guide
document.summary: Provides usage information for developers (all experience levels) of databases and database applications.

document.title: SQL Developer User's Guide
document.summary: Provides conceptual and usage information about Oracle SQL Developer, a graphical tool that enables you to browse, create, edit, and delete (drop) database objects; run SQL statements and scripts; edit and debug PL/SQL code; manipulate and export data; migrate third-party databases to Oracle; view metadata and data in third-party databases; and view and create reports.Note: This book is for an old release of SQL Developer. You are encouraged to use the latest available release. See http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/developer-tools/sql-developer/ for information about downloads and documentation.

document.title: SQL*Plus Release Notes
document.summary: Contains important information not included in the SQL*Plus User's Guide and Reference.

document.title: SQL*Plus User's Guide and Reference
document.summary: Contains a complete description of the SQL*Plus command-line interface to Oracle Database, and a complete reference to SQL*Plus commands and syntax.

document.title: SQL*Plus Quick Reference
document.summary: Contains a complete list of SQL*Plus command syntax.

document.title: Security Guide
document.summary: Explains how to configure an Oracle database to use the default security features.

document.title: Advanced Security Guide
document.summary: Explains how to configure and use Oracle Database Advanced Security Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) and Oracle Data Redaction.

document.title: Enterprise User Security Administrator's Guide
document.summary: Explains how to configure and use enterprise users, which are users defined in a directory. The guide also covers administrative tasks related to enterprise user security.

document.title: Label Security Administrator's Guide
document.summary: Explains how to configure and use Oracle Label Security, which provides row-level access control based on the virtual private database technology of Oracle Database Enterprise Edition.

document.title: Database Vault Administrator's Guide
document.summary: Explains how to configure an Oracle database to use Oracle Database Vault, which enables users to restrict and monitor administrative user access.

document.title: Real Application Security Administrator's and Developer's Guide
document.summary: Describes how to implement Real Application Security on the database. Real Application Security is a new feature in Oracle Database 12c. Real Application Security is a database authorization model that enables end-to-end security for multitier applications. It provides an integrated solution to securing the database and application user communities. Also, it advances the security architecture of Oracle Database to meet existing and emerging demands of applications developed for the Internet.

document.title: Real Application Security Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Documents two Java packages: - oracle.security.xs contains the APIs for using lightweight user sessions - oracle.security.xs.admin contains the APIs for administering lightweight user session

document.title: Net Services Reference
document.summary: Contains complete listing with descriptions of the control utility commands and configuration file parameters available for managing components of Oracle Net Services.

document.title: Net Services Administrator's Guide
document.summary: Explains how to plan, configure, and manage enterprise-wide connectivity with Oracle Net Services.

document.title: Automatic Storage Management Administrator's Guide
document.summary: Describes how to administer Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM) for Oracle Database.

document.title: Backup and Recovery User's Guide
document.summary: Explains how to use Recovery Manager (RMAN) to back up, recover, and duplicate a database, and how to use Oracle Flashback Technology to restore all or a portion of your data to a previous state.

document.title: Backup and Recovery Reference
document.summary: Provides detailed descriptions of the Recovery Manager (RMAN) commands and recovery catalog views.

document.title: Advanced Replication Management API Reference
document.summary: Contains reference information about and step-by-step instructions for using the replication management API, which is a set of PL/SQL packages for setting up and managing an Advanced Replication environment. It also includes reference information about data dictionary views that are important for Advanced Replication and security considerations for an Advanced Replication environment.

document.title: Administrator's Reference for Linux and UNIX-Based Operating Systems
document.summary: Explains how to configure and manage Oracle Database on Linux and UNIX-based operating systems.

document.title: Platform Guide for Microsoft Windows
document.summary: Provides platform-specific information for configuring and using Oracle Database software on the Windows platform. Topics discussed include: architecture, services, tools, configuration, administration, tuning, backup, accounts, passwords, user authentication, registry parameters, and application development.

document.title: Testing Guide
document.summary: Provides information about how to assure the integrity of database changes and manage test data using Oracle Real Application Testing, data masking, and data subsetting.

tab.title: Application Development
tab.description: Application development for Oracle Database involves a wide range of programming technologies. The supporting documentation covers the languages, programming interfaces, and development tools in detail.

document.title: 2 Day Developer's Guide
document.summary: Explains general concepts behind development with Oracle Database, introduces basic features of SQL and PL/SQL, provides references to in-depth information elsewhere in Oracle Database library, and shows how to create a simple application.

document.title: 2 Day + Application Express Developer's Guide
document.summary: Introduces you to application development using Oracle Application Express. This manual shows you how to set up a development environment, or access a hosted demonstration environment. It then walks you through building an initial application, modifying it, and previewing it.

document.title: 2 Day + Java Developer's Guide
document.summary: Guides application developers on how to use Java to access and modify data in Oracle Database.

document.title: 2 Day + PHP Developer's Guide
document.summary: Provides a tutorial on how to develop PHP scripts that use the database languages SQL and PL/SQL to access and manipulate Oracle data.

document.title: Development Guide
document.summary: Provides usage information for developers (all experience levels) of databases and database applications.

document.title: Concepts
document.summary: Describes Oracle Database architecture and essential topics for database administrators and developers.

document.title: Security Guide
document.summary: Explains how to configure an Oracle database to use the default security features.

document.title: SecureFiles and Large Objects Developer's Guide
document.summary: Describes use of SecureFiles and large object data types BLOB, CLOB, NCLOB, and BFILE in application development. Presents APIs for working with LOBs in supported programmatic environments. Describes database file systems and the Oracle Database File System Hierarchical Store package.

document.title: Object-Relational Developer's Guide
document.summary: Explains how to use the object-relational features of Oracle Database.

document.title: Workspace Manager Developer's Guide
document.summary: Provides usage and reference information about Oracle Workspace Manager, which enables applications to create workspaces and group different versions of table row values in different workspaces.

document.title: Migration Guide
document.summary: Describes the installation, configuration, and administration tasks for all activities related to migrating applications to Oracle Database from other databases, including DB2, MySQL, and Sybase.

document.title: Database Provider for DRDA User's Guide for Linux x86-64
document.summary: Describes how customers who have a large investment in DB2-based applications can migrate to Oracle Database while keeping these applications largely unchanged.

document.title: ODBC Driver Release Notes
document.summary: Describes new features, functionality, platforms supported, software required, server requirements, hardware required, testing matrix, UNIX platform certification matrix, post-installation, known issues, and software problems fixed.

document.title: SQL Language Reference
document.summary: Contains a complete description of Oracle SQL, the language used to manage information in Oracle Database.

document.title: SQL Language Quick Reference
document.summary: Contains a high-level text description of the SQL syntax used to manage information in Oracle Database.

document.title: PL/SQL Language Reference
document.summary: Presents PL/SQL, the Oracle procedural extension of SQL, an advanced fourth-generation programming language. Explains the concepts behind PL/SQL and illustrates every facet of the language.

document.title: PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference
document.summary: Describes the PL/SQL packages provided with the Oracle database server that extend database functionality and provide PL/SQL access to SQL features.

document.title: Application Express SQL Workshop Guide
document.summary: Describes how to use Oracle Application Express SQL Workshop and utilities to load and unload data from an Oracle database, generate DDL, view object reports, and restore dropped database objects.

document.title: Sample Schemas
document.summary: Describes the sample database schemas available with Oracle Database and used in some Oracle documentation and curriculum examples.

document.title: SQL Developer User's Guide
document.summary: Provides conceptual and usage information about Oracle SQL Developer, a graphical tool that enables you to browse, create, edit, and delete (drop) database objects; run SQL statements and scripts; edit and debug PL/SQL code; manipulate and export data; migrate third-party databases to Oracle; view metadata and data in third-party databases; and view and create reports.Note: This book is for an old release of SQL Developer. You are encouraged to use the latest available release. See http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/developer-tools/sql-developer/ for information about downloads and documentation.

document.title: SQL*Plus Release Notes
document.summary: Contains important information not included in the SQL*Plus User's Guide and Reference.

document.title: SQL*Plus User's Guide and Reference
document.summary: Contains a complete description of the SQL*Plus command-line interface to Oracle Database, and a complete reference to SQL*Plus commands and syntax.

document.title: SQL*Plus Quick Reference
document.summary: Contains a complete list of SQL*Plus command syntax.

document.title: Extensions for .NET Developer's Guide for Microsoft Windows
document.summary: Provides introductory, installation, post-installation configuration, and usage information for Oracle Database Extensions for .NET, which makes it possible to build and run .NET stored procedures or functions with Oracle Database for Microsoft Windows.

document.title: 2 Day + Application Express Developer's Guide
document.summary: Introduces you to application development using Oracle Application Express. This manual shows you how to set up a development environment, or access a hosted demonstration environment. It then walks you through building an initial application, modifying it, and previewing it.

document.title: Application Express Release Notes
document.summary: Contains important information not included in the documentation for Oracle Application Express.

document.title: Application Express Installation Guide
document.summary: Provides an overview of installing Oracle Application Express and describes issues to consider before installing.

document.title: Application Express Administration Guide
document.summary: Describes how to perform administration tasks for an Oracle Application Express workspace, application, or an entire development instance.

document.title: Application Express API Reference
document.summary: Describes the Application Programming Interfaces, referred to as APIs, available when programming in the Oracle Application Express environment.

document.title: Application Express Application Builder User's Guide
document.summary: Describes how to use the Oracle Application Express development environment to build and deploy database-centric Web applications.

document.title: Application Express Application Migration Guide
document.summary: Describes how to convert applications from either Microsoft Access or Oracle Forms to Oracle Application Express.

document.title: Application Express SQL Workshop Guide
document.summary: Describes how to use Oracle Application Express SQL Workshop and utilities to load and unload data from an Oracle database, generate DDL, view object reports, and restore dropped database objects.

document.title: Application Express End User Guide
document.summary: Explains common Oracle Application Express end user tasks.

document.title: 2 Day + Java Developer's Guide
document.summary: Guides application developers on how to use Java to access and modify data in Oracle Database.

document.title: Java Developer's Guide
document.summary: Describes how to develop, load, and run Java applications in Oracle Database.

document.title: JDBC Developer's Guide
document.summary: Describes how to use Oracle JDBC drivers to develop powerful Java database applications.

document.title: Universal Connection Pool for JDBC Developer's Guide
document.summary: Provides instructions for using Oracle Universal Connection Pooling API. The API is JDBC driver agnostic.

document.title: OLAP Java API Developer's Guide
document.summary: Provides guidance for developing client applications using the Oracle OLAP Java API.

document.title: SQLJ Developer's Guide
document.summary: Provides guidance to developers on SQLJ programming. This document can be read by anyone with an interest in SQLJ programming, but assumes at least some prior knowledge of Java, SQLJ, PL/SQL, and Oracle database.

document.title: JPublisher User's Guide
document.summary: Describes the JPublisher utility useful for Java programmers who want classes in their applications to correspond to SQL or PL/SQL entities or server-side Java classes.

document.title: JDBC Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Provides Java API reference for Java Database connectivity.

document.title: OLAP Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Provides reference information for the Oracle OLAP Java API.

document.title: Globalization Development Kit Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Describes APIs for the Oracle Globalization Development Kit.

document.title: Universal Connection Pool for JDBC Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Provides Java API reference for Universal Connection Pool for JDBC.

document.title: RAC FAN Events Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Provides easy access to Oracle Fast Application Notification (FAN) events.

document.title: XML Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Describes Java APIs for XML.

document.title: Spatial and Graph Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Provides Javadoc-generated information about interfaces and classes that support features available with Oracle Spatial and Graph, including GeoRaster and the Topology Data Model and Network Data Model Graph features, and with MapViewer, which is packaged with Oracle Fusion Middleware.

document.title: Multimedia Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using Oracle Multimedia objects to manage multimedia content within Oracle Database.

document.title: Multimedia DICOM Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using the Oracle Multimedia object designed to store Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) data within Oracle Database.

document.title: Multimedia Mid-Tier Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using Oracle Multimedia to extract Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) metadata outside of the database, either on the client or in the middle tier.

document.title: Multimedia Servlets and JSP Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using Java servlets and JavaServer Pages (JSP) to retrieve and upload multimedia data from and to Oracle Database.

document.title: Data Provider for .NET Developer's Guide for Microsoft Windows
document.summary: Describes provider-specific features and properties of ODP.NET. Oracle Data Provider for .NET is an implementation of Microsoft's ADO.NET interface and provides access to Oracle databases.

document.title: Providers for ASP.NET Developer's Guide for Microsoft Windows
document.summary: Provides introductory, installation, postinstallation configuration, and usage information for using these providers with ASP.NET services and controls.

document.title: Extensions for .NET Developer's Guide for Microsoft Windows
document.summary: Provides introductory, installation, post-installation configuration, and usage information for Oracle Database Extensions for .NET, which makes it possible to build and run .NET stored procedures or functions with Oracle Database for Microsoft Windows.

document.title: Services for Microsoft Transaction Server Developer's Guide for Microsoft Windows
document.summary: Describes Oracle Services for Microsoft Transaction Server, which allows Oracle databases to be used as resource managers in distributed transactions. The guide describes its usage and configuration in a Microsoft Distributed Transaction Coordinator environment.

document.title: Provider for OLE DB Developer's Guide for Microsoft Windows
document.summary: Describes Oracle Provider for OLE DB, a high performance, feature rich mechanism for Microsoft ADO and OLE DB data access to Oracle databases, its usage, and its configuration.

document.title: Data Provider for .NET Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database Support User's Guide for Windows
document.summary: Enables ADO.NET data access from .NET client applications to TimesTen databases. This document covers features specific to ODP.NET support of and use with TimesTen.

document.title: XML DB Developer's Guide
document.summary: This manual describes Oracle XML DB. It includes guidelines and examples for storing, generating, accessing, searching, validating, transforming, evolving, and indexing XML data in Oracle Database.

document.title: XML Developer's Kit Programmer's Guide
document.summary: Provides information to application developers who need to use components of the Oracle XML Developer's Kit (XDK) to generate and store XML data in a database or in a document outside the database.

document.title: XML Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Describes Java APIs for XML.

document.title: XML C API Reference
document.summary: Describes Oracle XML Developer's Kits (XDK) and Oracle XML DB APIs for the C programming language. It primarily lists the syntax of functions, methods, and procedures associated with these APIs.

document.title: XML C++ API Reference
document.summary: Describes Oracle XML Developer's Kits (XDK) and Oracle XML DB APIs for the C++ programming language. This manual primarily lists the syntax of functions, methods, and procedures associated with these APIs.

document.title: Globalization Support Guide
document.summary: Describes Oracle globalization support for the database. Explains how to set up a globalization support environment, choose and migrate a character set, customize locale data, do linguistic sorting, program in a global environment, and program with Unicode.

document.title: Globalization Development Kit Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Describes APIs for the Oracle Globalization Development Kit.

document.title: Migration Assistant for Unicode Release Notes
document.summary: Contains late-breaking information for Oracle Database Migration Assistant for Unicode.

document.title: Migration Assistant for Unicode Guide
document.summary: Introduces you to the Oracle Database Migration Assistant for Unicode, discusses the database character set migration process, and verifies that there are no character set data problems in a current Unicode database.

document.title: Oracle Call Interface Programmer's Guide
document.summary: Describes the Oracle Call Interface (OCI) which is an application programming interface (API) that allows applications written in C or C++ to interact with Oracle Database.

document.title: Oracle C++ Call Interface Programmer's Guide
document.summary: Presents the Oracle C++ Call Interface, an application program interface that enables applications written in C++ to interact with one or more Oracle databases. To extend the functionality of code generated by the Object Type Translator, programmers may want to add code in the OTT-generated file. The OTT can distinguish between OTT-generated code and user-generated code by looking for some predefined markers (tags).

document.title: Programmer's Guide to the Oracle Precompilers
document.summary: Describes how to develop applications using the Oracle precompilers and the SQL and PL/SQL database languages to access and manipulate Oracle data.

document.title: Pro*C/C++ Programmer's Guide
document.summary: Describes how to develop C++ programs that use the SQL and PL/SQL database languages to access and manipulate Oracle data.

document.title: Pro*COBOL Programmer's Guide
document.summary: Describes how to develop COBOL programs that use the database languages SQL and PL/SQL to access and manipulate Oracle data.

document.title: Pro*FORTRAN Supplement to the Oracle Precompilers Guide
document.summary: Supplements the Oracle Database Programmer's Guide to the Oracle precompilers to provide additional information on how to develop FORTRAN programs that use the database languages SQL and PL/SQL to access and manipulate Oracle data.

document.title: Pro*C/C++ Release Notes
document.summary: Contains important information not included in the Pro*C/C++ Programmer's Guide.

document.title: Pro*COBOL Release Notes
document.summary: Contains important information not included in the Pro*COBOL Programmer's Guide.

tab.title: Clustering
tab.description: Clustering relieves users from concerns about where data resides and which computer processes their requests. Users request information or computation and have it delivered - as much as they want, whenever they want. For the DBA, the grid is about resource allocation, information sharing, and high availability. Oracle Database with Real Application Clusters and Oracle Clusterware provide the infrastructure for your database grid. Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM) provides the infrastructure for a storage grid. Oracle Enterprise Manager Grid Control provides you with holistic management of your grid.

document.title: 2 Day + Real Application Clusters Guide
document.summary: Describes how to install, configure, and administer Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) on a two-node system using the Oracle Linux operating system.

document.title: Quality of Service Management User's Guide
document.summary: Describes the concepts of Oracle Database Quality of Service Management (Oracle Database QoS Management), and explains how to configure, administer, and troubleshoot Oracle Database QoS Management.

document.title: Real Application Clusters Administration and Deployment Guide
document.summary: Describes the Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) architecture and provides an overview of this product. This book also describes administrative and deployment topics for Oracle RAC.

document.title: Global Data Services Concepts and Administration Guide
document.summary: Provides dynamic load balancing, failover, and centralized service management for a set of replicated databases that offer common services. The set of databases can include Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) and noncluster Oracle databases interconnected through Oracle Data Guard, or any other replication technology.

document.title: Clusterware Administration and Deployment Guide
document.summary: Describes the Oracle Clusterware architecture and provides an overview of this product. This book also describes administrative and deployment topics for Oracle Clusterware.

document.title: Automatic Storage Management Administrator's Guide
document.summary: Describes how to administer Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM) for Oracle Database.

tab.title: Videos
tab.description: Videos provide quick overviews and short demonstrations of features and tasks.

document.title: 2 Day + Performance Tuning Guide
document.summary: Explains how to perform day-to-day database performance tuning tasks using features provided by Oracle Diagnostics Pack, Oracle Tuning Pack, and Oracle Enterprise Manager Cloud Control.

document.title: Performance Tuning Guide
document.summary: Provides information about how to tune the performance of Oracle Database using Oracle performance tools.

document.title: SQL Tuning Guide
document.summary: Describes how to perform SQL tuning, which is the iterative process of improving SQL statement performance to meet specific, measurable, and achievable goals.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database Release Notes
document.summary: Contains important information not included in the documentation for Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

document.title: TimesTen Application-Tier Database Cache Introduction
document.summary: Describes the features of TimesTen Application-Tier Database Cache and provides information to help developers plan a TimesTen Cache application.

document.title: TimesTen Application-Tier Database Cache User's Guide
document.summary: Provides information about designing and configuring the TimesTen Application-Tier Database Cache. It includes information about setting up a cache grid.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database C Developer's Guide
document.summary: Provides information about developing C applications to access the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database through ODBC. It also includes information about TimesTen support for XLA, OCI, and the Pro*C/C++ Precompiler.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database Error Messages and SNMP Traps
document.summary: Provides a reference for Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database error messages and SNMP traps.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database Installation Guide
document.summary: Provides information about installing and upgrading the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database Java Developer's Guide
document.summary: Provides information about developing Java applications to access the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database through JDBC. It also includes information about support for TimesTen JMS/XLA.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database JDBC Extensions Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Provides reference information for TimesTen JDBC classes and interfaces.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database JMS/XLA Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Provides reference information for TimesTen JMS/XLA classes and interfaces.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database Operations Guide
document.summary: Provides information about how Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database works. It includes step-by-step instructions and examples that show how to perform commonly needed tasks.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database PL/SQL Developer's Guide
document.summary: Provides information about using PL/SQL with the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database PL/SQL Packages Reference
document.summary: Provides reference information for packages provided with TimesTen PL/SQL.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database Reference
document.summary: Provides a reference for attributes, built-in procedures, utilities, and system limits for the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database Replication Guide
document.summary: Provides information about designing and configuring TimesTen to TimesTen replication, including information about TimesTen integration with Oracle Clusterware.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database SQL Reference
document.summary: Provides a reference for SQL statements, expressions, and functions used with the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database, including TimesTen SQL extensions. It also describes data types.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database System Tables and Views Reference
document.summary: Describes TimesTen system tables and replication tables.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database Troubleshooting Guide
document.summary: Provides information about utilities and procedures for troubleshooting problems that may be encountered when using the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

document.title: TimesTen In-Memory Database TTClasses Guide
document.summary: Describes how to use the TimesTen C++ Interface Classes (TTClasses) library.

document.title: Enterprise Manager for Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database Release Notes
document.summary: Provides late-breaking information about the Oracle Enterprise Manager Plug-in for Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

document.title: Enterprise Manager for Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database User's Guide
document.summary: Describes how to install the Oracle Enterprise Manager Plug-in for Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

document.title: Data Provider for .NET Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database Support User's Guide for Windows
document.summary: Enables ADO.NET data access from .NET client applications to TimesTen databases. This document covers features specific to ODP.NET support of and use with TimesTen.

document.title: High Availability Overview
document.summary: Introduces Oracle MAA solutions for deploying a highly available environment, helps you determine your availability requirements, and describes the database architectures that can help your business achieve high availability.

document.title: High Availability Best Practices
document.summary: Provides high availability best practices for configuring and maintaining your Oracle Database system and network components.

document.title: Data Guard Broker
document.summary: Describes the Oracle Data Guard broker, a management and monitoring interface that automates many of the tasks involved in configuring and monitoring standby databases in an Oracle Data Guard configuration.

document.title: Data Guard Concepts and Administration
document.summary: Provides a comprehensive overview of Oracle Data Guard concepts and describes how to configure and implement standby databases that can take over production operations if your production database becomes unusable. This guide includes several database scenarios such as creating, recovering, failing over, switching over, configuring, and backing up standby and primary databases.

document.title: Global Data Services Concepts and Administration Guide
document.summary: Provides dynamic load balancing, failover, and centralized service management for a set of replicated databases that offer common services. The set of databases can include Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) and noncluster Oracle databases interconnected through Oracle Data Guard, or any other replication technology.

document.title: Global Data Services Concepts and Administration Guide
document.summary: Provides dynamic load balancing, failover, and centralized service management for a set of replicated databases that offer common services. The set of databases can include Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) and noncluster Oracle databases interconnected through Oracle Data Guard, or any other replication technology.

document.title: Backup and Recovery User's Guide
document.summary: Explains how to use Recovery Manager (RMAN) to back up, recover, and duplicate a database, and how to use Oracle Flashback Technology to restore all or a portion of your data to a previous state.

document.title: Backup and Recovery Reference
document.summary: Provides detailed descriptions of the Recovery Manager (RMAN) commands and recovery catalog views.

document.title: Streams Concepts and Administration
document.summary: Contains conceptual information about Oracle Streams and information about administering, monitoring, and troubleshooting an Oracle Streams environment. It also contains instructions for using Oracle Streams to record table changes. It also contains conceptual information about information provisioning and instructions for using Oracle Streams for information provisioning. It also includes instructions for using Oracle Streams for database upgrades and database maintenance operations.

document.title: Streams Replication Administrator's Guide
document.summary: Contains instructions for configuring and managing an Oracle Streams replication environment. It also includes best practices for Oracle Streams replication environments and instructions for migrating from Advanced Replication to Oracle Streams replication.

document.title: Streams Extended Examples
document.summary: Contains extended examples that configure various types of Oracle Streams environments.

document.title: PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference
document.summary: Describes the PL/SQL packages provided with the Oracle database server that extend database functionality and provide PL/SQL access to SQL features.

document.title: Reference
document.summary: Provides reference information about database initialization parameters, static data dictionary views, and dynamic performance views that are part of Oracle Database.

document.title: XStream Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Describes the Java APIs for XStream.

document.title: Advanced Replication
document.summary: Contains conceptual information about Oracle Database Advanced Replication. It also includes information about planning an Advanced Replication environment and information about troubleshooting Advanced Replication problems.

document.title: Advanced Replication Management API Reference
document.summary: Contains reference information about and step-by-step instructions for using the replication management API, which is a set of PL/SQL packages for setting up and managing an Advanced Replication environment. It also includes reference information about data dictionary views that are important for Advanced Replication and security considerations for an Advanced Replication environment.

tab.title: Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence
tab.description: Data Warehousing involves large volumes of data used primarily for analysis. This category covers applications such as Business Intelligence and Decision Support Systems.

document.title: Data Warehousing Guide
document.summary: Provides conceptual, reference, and implementation material for using Oracle Database in data warehousing. It covers the full range of data warehousing activities, from physical database design to advanced calculation techniques.

document.title: Performance Tuning Guide
document.summary: Provides information about how to tune the performance of Oracle Database using Oracle performance tools.

document.title: SQL Tuning Guide
document.summary: Describes how to perform SQL tuning, which is the iterative process of improving SQL statement performance to meet specific, measurable, and achievable goals.

document.title: VLDB and Partitioning Guide
document.summary: Contains an overview of very large database (VLDB) topics, with emphasis on partitioning and parallel execution as a key component of the VLDB strategy.

document.title: Utilities
document.summary: Describes how to use Oracle Database utilities to load data into a database, transfer data between databases, and maintain data. The topics discussed include Data Pump Export, Data Pump Import, SQL*Loader, external tables and associated access drivers, the Automatic Diagnostic Repository Command Interpreter (ADRCI), DBVERIFY, DBNEWID, LogMiner, the Metadata API, original Export, and original Import.

document.title: OLAP User's Guide
document.summary: Explains how SQL applications can extend their analytic processing capabilities and manage summary data by using the OLAP option of Oracle Database.

document.title: OLAP Customizing Analytic Workspace Manager
document.summary: Describes the Analytic Workspace Manager XML and Java plug-in interfaces and provides simple examples of implementations of them.

document.title: OLAP DML Reference
document.summary: Contains a complete description of the OLAP Data Manipulation Language (OLAP DML) used to define and manipulate analytic workspace objects.

document.title: OLAP Expression Syntax Reference
document.summary: Describes the Oracle OLAP expression syntax used to generate information-rich content from the data stored in dimensional database objects such as cubes and cube dimensions.

document.title: OLAP Java API Developer's Guide
document.summary: Provides guidance for developing client applications using the Oracle OLAP Java API.

document.title: OLAP Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Provides reference information for the Oracle OLAP Java API.

document.title: Data Mining Concepts
document.summary: Discusses the basic concepts underlying Oracle Data Mining. Includes an overview of the features of Oracle Data Mining and information about mining functions and algorithms.

document.title: Data Mining User's Guide
document.summary: Explains how to use the SQL interface to Oracle Data Mining to create models and score data. This Guide also addresses administrative issues such as security, import/export, and upgrade for Oracle Data Mining.

document.title: R Enterprise Release Notes
document.summary: Contains important information that was not included in the documentation for Oracle R Enterprise 1.2.

document.title: R Enterprise User's Guide
document.summary: Describes how to install and use Oracle R Enterprise which provides an environment for statistical computing.

tab.title: Unstructured Data and Content Management
tab.description: Oracle Secure Files provides enhanced LOB-type storage for applications managing all types of data. Implement applications that deliver performance comparable to file system storage, with rich information retrieval capabilities organized around specialized semantic content models, such as relational, XML-based, full text, spatial, and multimedia data.

portlet.title: Oracle Secure Files and Large Objects

document.title: SecureFiles and Large Objects Developer's Guide
document.summary: Describes use of SecureFiles and large object data types BLOB, CLOB, NCLOB, and BFILE in application development. Presents APIs for working with LOBs in supported programmatic environments. Describes database file systems and the Oracle Database File System Hierarchical Store package.

document.title: XML DB Developer's Guide
document.summary: This manual describes Oracle XML DB. It includes guidelines and examples for storing, generating, accessing, searching, validating, transforming, evolving, and indexing XML data in Oracle Database.

document.title: XML Developer's Kit Programmer's Guide
document.summary: Provides information to application developers who need to use components of the Oracle XML Developer's Kit (XDK) to generate and store XML data in a database or in a document outside the database.

document.title: XML Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Describes Java APIs for XML.

document.title: XML C API Reference
document.summary: Describes Oracle XML Developer's Kits (XDK) and Oracle XML DB APIs for the C programming language. It primarily lists the syntax of functions, methods, and procedures associated with these APIs.

document.title: XML C++ API Reference
document.summary: Describes Oracle XML Developer's Kits (XDK) and Oracle XML DB APIs for the C++ programming language. This manual primarily lists the syntax of functions, methods, and procedures associated with these APIs.

document.title: Text Application Developer's Guide
document.summary: Provides information for building applications with Oracle Text.

document.title: Text Reference
document.summary: Provides reference information for building applications with Oracle Text.

document.title: Spatial and Graph Developer's Guide
document.summary: Provides usage and reference information for indexing and storing spatial data and for developing spatial applications using Oracle Spatial and Graph and Oracle Locator.

document.title: Spatial and Graph GeoRaster Developer's Guide
document.summary: Provides usage and reference information for the GeoRaster feature of Oracle Spatial and Graph, which lets you store, index, query, analyze, and deliver raster data (raster image and gridded data and its associated metadata).

document.title: Spatial and Graph Topology Data Model and Network Data Model Graph Developer's Guide
document.summary: Provides usage and reference information about the Topology Data Model and Network Data Model Graph features of Oracle Spatial and Graph.

document.title: Spatial and Graph Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Provides Javadoc-generated information about interfaces and classes that support features available with Oracle Spatial and Graph, including GeoRaster and the Topology Data Model and Network Data Model Graph features, and with MapViewer, which is packaged with Oracle Fusion Middleware.

document.title: Multimedia User's Guide
document.summary: Presents information about using Oracle Database to store, manage, and retrieve images, audio, video, DICOM format medical images and other objects, or other heterogeneous media data in an integrated fashion with other enterprise information. Oracle Multimedia extends Oracle Database reliability, availability, and data management to multimedia content in traditional, Internet, electronic commerce, medical, financial, and other media-rich applications.

document.title: Multimedia DICOM Developer's Guide
document.summary: Presents reference and other information about using Oracle Database to store, manage, and retrieve DICOM content such as single-frame and multiframe images, waveforms, slices of 3-D volumes, video segments, and structured reports in an integrated fashion with other enterprise information. Oracle Multimedia DICOM extends Oracle Database reliability, availability, and data management to media objects in medical applications. Oracle Multimedia DICOM supports Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine, the standard for medical images.

document.title: Multimedia Reference
document.summary: Presents reference information about using Oracle Database to store, manage, and retrieve images, audio, video, DICOM format medical images and other objects, or other heterogeneous media data in an integrated fashion with other enterprise information. Oracle Multimedia extends Oracle Database reliability, availability, and data management to multimedia content in Internet, electronic commerce, medical, financial, and other media-rich applications.

document.title: Multimedia Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using Oracle Multimedia objects to manage multimedia content within Oracle Database.

document.title: Multimedia DICOM Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using the Oracle Multimedia object designed to store Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) data within Oracle Database.

document.title: Multimedia Mid-Tier Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using Oracle Multimedia to extract Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) metadata outside of the database, either on the client or in the middle tier.

document.title: Multimedia Servlets and JSP Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using Java servlets and JavaServer Pages (JSP) to retrieve and upload multimedia data from and to Oracle Database.

document.title: Data Cartridge Developer's Guide
document.summary: Describes how to implement custom indexing and query optimization services and how to package and use these as a server extension called a data cartridge.

document.title: Spatial and Graph RDF Semantic Graph Developer's Guide
document.summary: Provides usage and reference information about Oracle Database support for semantic technologies, including storage, inference, and query capabilities for data and ontologies based on Resource Description Framework (RDF), RDF Schema (RDFS), and Web Ontology Language (OWL).

document.title: Object-Relational Developer's Guide
document.summary: Explains how to use the object-relational features of Oracle Database.

tab.title: Information Integration
tab.description: To take full advantage of your data, you might need to move it, transform it, and combine data from multiple sources.

document.title: Advanced Queuing User's Guide
document.summary: Describes features of application development and integration using Oracle Database Advanced Queuing (AQ). This information applies to versions of the Oracle Database server that run on all platforms, unless otherwise specified.

document.title: Advanced Queuing Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Describes the Java APIs for application development and integration using the Oracle messaging system, Advanced Queuing.

document.title: XStream Guide
document.summary: Contains conceptual information about XStream. Also contains instructions for configuring and using XStream.

document.title: XStream Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Describes the Java APIs for XStream.

document.title: Streams Concepts and Administration
document.summary: Contains conceptual information about Oracle Streams and information about administering, monitoring, and troubleshooting an Oracle Streams environment. It also contains instructions for using Oracle Streams to record table changes. It also contains conceptual information about information provisioning and instructions for using Oracle Streams for information provisioning. It also includes instructions for using Oracle Streams for database upgrades and database maintenance operations.

document.title: Streams Replication Administrator's Guide
document.summary: Contains instructions for configuring and managing an Oracle Streams replication environment. It also includes best practices for Oracle Streams replication environments and instructions for migrating from Advanced Replication to Oracle Streams replication.

document.title: Streams Extended Examples
document.summary: Contains extended examples that configure various types of Oracle Streams environments.

document.title: PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference
document.summary: Describes the PL/SQL packages provided with the Oracle database server that extend database functionality and provide PL/SQL access to SQL features.

document.title: Reference
document.summary: Provides reference information about database initialization parameters, static data dictionary views, and dynamic performance views that are part of Oracle Database.

document.title: Database Gateway for APPC Installation and Configuration Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit), Linux x86-64, Oracle Solaris on SPARC (64-Bit), and HP-UX Itanium
document.summary: Provides Oracle applications with seamless access to IBM mainframe data and services through Remote Procedure Call (RPC) processing.

document.title: Database Gateway for APPC Installation and Configuration Guide for Microsoft Windows
document.summary: Provides Oracle applications with seamless access to IBM mainframe data and services through Remote Procedure Call (RPC) processing.

document.title: Database Gateway for WebSphere MQ Installation and User's Guide
document.summary: Provides access to WebSphere MQ services. This gateway requires a system that is capable of running 64-bit applications.

document.title: Database Gateway Installation and Configuration Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit), Linux x86-64, Oracle Solaris on SPARC (64-Bit), Oracle Solaris on x86-64 (64-Bit), and HP-UX Itanium
document.summary: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database Gateway for Sybase, Informix, Teradata, SQL Server, ODBC, and DRDA on UNIX-based platforms.

document.title: Database Gateway Installation and Configuration Guide for Microsoft Windows
document.summary: Describes how to install Oracle Database Gateway for Sybase, Informix, Teradata, SQL Server, ODBC, and DRDA on Microsoft Windows (32-bit) and Microsoft Windows (64-bit) platform.

document.title: Gateway for APPC User's Guide
document.summary: Provides Oracle applications seamless access to virtually any APPC-enabled system, including IBM mainframe data and services through Remote Procedure Call (RPC) processing.

document.title: Gateway for DRDA User's Guide
document.summary: Provides users with transparent access to DB2.

document.title: Gateway for Informix User's Guide
document.summary: Describes the Oracle Database Gateway for Informix, which enables Oracle client applications to access Informix data through Structured Query Language (SQL).

document.title: Gateway for ODBC User's Guide
document.summary: Describes the Oracle Database Gateway for ODBC, which enables Oracle client applications to access non-Oracle systems data through Structured Query Language (SQL).

document.title: Gateway for SQL Server User's Guide
document.summary: Describes the Oracle Database Gateway for SQL Server, which enables Oracle client applications to access SQL Server data through Structured Query Language (SQL).

document.title: Gateway for Sybase User's Guide
document.summary: Describes the Oracle Database Gateway for Sybase, which enables Oracle client applications to access Sybase data through Structured Query Language (SQL).

document.title: Gateway for Teradata User's Guide
document.summary: Describes the Oracle Database Gateway for Teradata, which enables Oracle client applications to access Teradata data through Structured Query Language (SQL).

document.title: Heterogeneous Connectivity User's Guide
document.summary: Describes Oracle's approach to information integration in a heterogeneous environment. Describes Oracle Database Gateways and is a user's guide for these Oracle products.

document.title: Advanced Replication
document.summary: Contains conceptual information about Oracle Database Advanced Replication. It also includes information about planning an Advanced Replication environment and information about troubleshooting Advanced Replication problems.

document.title: Advanced Replication Management API Reference
document.summary: Contains reference information about and step-by-step instructions for using the replication management API, which is a set of PL/SQL packages for setting up and managing an Advanced Replication environment. It also includes reference information about data dictionary views that are important for Advanced Replication and security considerations for an Advanced Replication environment.

document.title: Net Services Administrator's Guide
document.summary: Explains how to plan, configure, and manage enterprise-wide connectivity with Oracle Net Services.

document.title: Net Services Reference
document.summary: Contains complete listing with descriptions of the control utility commands and configuration file parameters available for managing components of Oracle Net Services.

document.title: Administrator's Guide
document.summary: Describes how to create, configure, and administer an Oracle database. Includes sections on Oracle Scheduler, Oracle Database Resource Manager, Oracle Restart, Pluggable Databases, and distributed computing.

tab.title: Security
tab.description: Security has never been more important as databases have become a target for gaining access to valuable information. Oracle Database has a wealth of security features spanning preventive, detective, and administrative controls.

document.title: 2 Day + Security Guide
document.summary: Provides an introduction to securing an Oracle database using the default security features, such as how to secure the database installation and configuration or manage encryption. It includes beginning level tutorials for creating secure application roles, Oracle Database Vault policies, Oracle Virtual Private Database policies, Oracle Data Redaction policies, Oracle Label Security policies, and unified auditing policies.

document.title: Security Guide
document.summary: Explains how to configure an Oracle database to use the default security features.

document.title: Advanced Security Guide
document.summary: Explains how to configure and use Oracle Database Advanced Security Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) and Oracle Data Redaction.

document.title: Database Vault Administrator's Guide
document.summary: Explains how to configure an Oracle database to use Oracle Database Vault, which enables users to restrict and monitor administrative user access.

document.title: Label Security Administrator's Guide
document.summary: Explains how to configure and use Oracle Label Security, which provides row-level access control based on the virtual private database technology of Oracle Database Enterprise Edition.

document.title: Real Application Security Administration
document.summary: Provides a graphical user interface (RASADM) that security administrators and developers using Real Application Security can use to develop end-to-end security for mid-tier applications. The RASADM application allows users to develop declarative data security policies to enforce access control requirements at the database layer to protect data at both the row and column levels. This approach allows developers to control application user access to data in Oracle database throughout all components of an Oracle enterprise in a common manner.

document.title: Real Application Security Administrator's and Developer's Guide
document.summary: Describes how to implement Real Application Security on the database. Real Application Security is a new feature in Oracle Database 12c. Real Application Security is a database authorization model that enables end-to-end security for multitier applications. It provides an integrated solution to securing the database and application user communities. Also, it advances the security architecture of Oracle Database to meet existing and emerging demands of applications developed for the Internet.

document.title: Real Application Security Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Documents two Java packages: - oracle.security.xs contains the APIs for using lightweight user sessions - oracle.security.xs.admin contains the APIs for administering lightweight user session

document.title: Real Application Security Session Service Java API Reference (Javadoc)
document.summary: Documents one Java package: - oracle.security.xs.ee.session contains the APIs for using an application session service.

document.title: Enterprise User Security Administrator's Guide
document.summary: Explains how to configure and use enterprise users, which are users defined in a directory. The guide also covers administrative tasks related to enterprise user security.

document.title: Data Masking and Subsetting Guide
document.summary: Provides information about how to manage data using the Oracle Data Masking and Subsetting features of the Enterprise Manager for Oracle Database Plug-in.

document.title: Oracle Audit Vault and Database Firewall Product Information
